TopicTitle: Switch craft without changing to map view

Articles.Content:
Edit: Michaelo/Pursuedtank have kindly corrected my ignorance. In case anyone reaches this in the future there are keybinds, default [ and ], which do pretty much exactly what I was after.

Why can't I click the ship/rover/kerbal that is right in front of me and change to piloting it. It really doesn't make any sense that I have to change to map view first, or in the case of having multiple craft on the same location, having to go back to the space center.

If I can target something in my screen in the piloting view, I should be able to take control of it. Does anyone have a reason it shouldn't be like that?

Edited June 2, 2014 by RobertK

There are keyboard bindings to switch between vessels within physics range, look at the misc tab in the input settings. I think the standard bindings is [ and ] , but I'm not sure since i had to change it, it didn't work with a swedish keyboard.
That'll be the [ and ] keys to change to a vessel within physics range.
